original_title: Sri Lanka sells Rs180bn in T-bill auction, 6-month down 129bp
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka sold all offered 180 billion rupees of Treasury bills at an auction on Wednesday with six months and one year yields falling above 100 basis points, data from the state debt office showed.
The debt office sold 98 billion rupees in 3-month bills at 23.16 percent, down 5 basis points from a week earlier, after offering 70 billion rupees.
A total of 68.7 billion rupees in 6-month bills were sold at 20.61 percent, down 129 basis points from a week earlier.
All offered 50 billion rupees of 12-month bills were sold at 18.08 percent, down 102 basis points from a week earlier. (Colombo/June14/2022)
